reviews.review: graficos ótimos e jogabilidade incrivel

Tons of fun playing as both killer and survivor! Definitely a team based game on the survivor side of things. Occasional lags and game issues, but they are pretty quickly solved. Best multiplayer game I've played in a while!

Now that i've played over 100 hours I can say that DBD is one of the best multiplayer games I've played in a long time. Most of the player community are great but of course every online multiplayer game has its campers (yes killers, i'm looking at you), annoying twats etc.. but overall this games style of play promotes teamwork and rewards it. Well worth the price and the devs are constantly working on additions to the game. The DLC is also always fairly priced with the fact you can also unlock some store stuff up with in game shards.

10/10 - would get hooked again!
a

I think I would recommend this game, its a fun team game to play with friends and get absolutely terrified by if you want to play casually, theres a relatively low skill floor with a really high skill ceiling so it can be fun both casually and competitively. People can be toxic sometimes but I find the nice people generally outweigh the toxic. Definitely worth picking up for a few hours of fun!

Developers work only 20 hours per week on average, updates are at a SNAILS pace, takes them years (not exaggerating here) to make basic changes the community has been asking for forever.

Insanely greedy devs that prefer to powercreep everything with the in-game cash shop: don't fix old abilities, introduce new, better ones (for cash!). I HATE that popular icons like Michael Myers, Ghostface, Pyramid Head, etc, are shackled to this cashgrab dumpster fire of a game. I hate that the "Smash Bros. of horror movies" is wasted on talentless developers like these.
I like horror in general

My original review was a mess, so I am cleaning it up.

When I originally started playing this game, it was because I enjoyed watching streamers (John Wolfe, Iosefka, Sinow) and I especially enjoyed seeing them have fun together. I made a group of friends through their communities, and we had fun -- for a time. The longer we played, the worse things got. Game-breaking bugs, server-side latency, the devs refusal to fix things in the game to make it playable and instead focus on making things more graphically appealing. Not to mention the toxic community on both sides of the fence.

In my experience, the game only keeps getting worse. The devs' response to all the hateful words in post-game chat was to slap a filter on it and call it a day. Reports don't get looked at or taken seriously. (They're supposedly adding an auto-ban function, but we'll see how long that lasts.) Intentionally DC'ing is a reportable action, yet they allowed it in their own tournament and called it "strategy." The same "strategy" that now allows killers to tunnel and camp survivors, making it so they can't even play most games. And these sorts of behaviors only get worse during events, including the game's anniversary events.

Play survivor and get toxic killers. Windows and pallets never work.
Play killer and get toxic survivors. Windows and pallets work as intended and you get screwed over.
Game still has latency and hit-detection problems. Getting hit by attacks around and sometimes even through walls.
Try to update the game and have to verify files multiple times before it finally updates. Fresh install? Same thing.

This game has given me an insurmountable level of stress and anger. I'm glad for the friends that I made through it; but nothing brought me more joy than hitting that uninstall button for the last time, as we've all moved on to a new game.
This is a good game it may have taken over my life ahahaha

this game is broken, unbalanced, full of toxic players, and rife with cheaters

Not going to lie, this game is pretty fun, many people say there are lots of toxic players which there are, but thats one of the really fun things in this game. Also this game is just overall fun, there is new graphics coming, more killers/survivors which just makes the game even more fun. But one thing that makes me annoyed is that chucky is still not in the game.

Not sure how this slipped by me for so long. Tons of fun. It is a lot creepier and gross looking to watch on streams than actually play for some reason. The major pros for this game is a core game mode which plays very differently than any of the major core games out there at the moment so if you're tired of MOBAS, BRs, FPS grind then look no further. DBD does have a big learning hurdle to get over at the very beginning so you will have to watch some tutorial videos before getting started. Go ahead and check them out before buying and let them help you decide if you're already interested.

A common issue mentioned is community "Toxicity". I really don't think this game is nearly as toxic as other, much more popular, much bigger budget games. The people complaining about it would be awful to bring along for a cards against humanity session and the people being toxic aren't worth your time anyway so close text chat and ignore it. DBD is a video game and you need to treat it like one.

Wanted to make an updated review, as my last was in 2020.

In short the game is dying due to balancing issues and you shouldn't bother buying/playing at this time.

For every match there's one killer and 4 survivors. From a financial standpoint you stand to make a lot more money catering to the survivors as there's simply more of them. Over time this has led to a slow death of killer players as the game heavily favors survivors. As of now there's very few killers because of this and survivor queue times are astronomically high. 

So if you play as a survivor you're playing a game with ever-lengthening wait times to play, and if you're playing as a killer, even a new killer - the demand for killer players is so high you'll be matched right out of the gate against seasoned survivors with fully ground out perks - because there's simply not enough killers to properly balance to new killers and new survivors.
